title: 의학통계학(MED2104)
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  기술통계
text:
2.2 기술통계량

2.2.1 소숫점 셋째자리 반올림


2.2.2 Minimum

min(data$age)

[1] 20




2.2.3 Maximum

max(data$age)

[1] 80




2.2.4 Range

range(data$age)

[1] 20 80

range(data$age)[1]#min

[1] 20

range(data$age)[2]#max

[1] 80




2.2.5 Quantile

quantile(data$age,0.25)

  25% 
37.75 

quantile(data$age,0.75)

  75% 
65.25 




2.2.6 interquartile range

IQR(data$age)

[1] 27.5




2.2.7 Standard devidation

sd(data$age)

[1] 16.97444




2.2.8 Variance

var(data$age)

[1] 288.1317




2.2.9 Skewness

library(moments)
skewness(data$age)

[1] 0.02470892




2.2.10 Kurtosis

kurtosis(data$age)

[1] 1.940932



# summary: Min, 1st quartile, Median, Mean, 3rd quartile, Max
summary(data$age)

   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  20.00   37.75   51.00   51.31   65.25   80.00 

# min: minimum
min(data$age)

[1] 20

# max: maximum
max(data$age)

[1] 80

# range: range = [min, max]
range(data$age)

[1] 20 80

# quantile: 
quantile(data$age, 0.25)

  25% 
37.75 

# IQR: interquartile range
IQR(data$age)

[1] 27.5

# Standard devidation: 
sd(data$age)

[1] 16.97444

# Variance: 
var(data$age)

[1] 288.1317

# Skewness
install.packages("moments", repos = 'http://cran.us.r-project.org')


다운로드된 바이너리 패키지들은 다음의 위치에 있습니다
    /var/folders/yp/03fysc6x5mqb63q6zm6wp_dm0000gn/T//RtmpSvqxsu/downloaded_packages

library(moments)
skewness(data$age)

[1] 0.02470892

# Kurtosis
kurtosis(data$age)

[1] 1.940932




2.2.11 Stem and leaf plot

stem(data$age)


  The decimal point is 1 digit(s) to the right of the |

  2 | 001111122222222333333344444444
  2 | 55555555666666677788889999999
  3 | 0000000001111112222333333334444444444
  3 | 55555556666666666777777777777888888888999999999
  4 | 0000000000111111122222222223333333333344444444
  4 | 5555555555555556666677777777778888888999999999
  5 | 0000000000000111111111222222233333333333344444
  5 | 555555566666666666677777778888888888888888999999999
  6 | 000000011222222222223333333344444444444
  6 | 5555666666666667777777788888899999999999
  7 | 000011111112222223333334444444444
  7 | 5555556666666667778889999999999
  8 | 0000000000000000000000000




2.2.12 Histogram

hist(data$age)

library(ggplot2)



pp <- ggplot(data, aes(x=age)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=1, color="blue", fill="white")
pp






2.2.13 Box plot

boxplot(data$age)



library(ggplot2)
pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=age)) + geom_boxplot()
pp






2.2.14 Box plot 2 groups

boxplot(data$age~data$sex)



library(ggplot2)
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)
pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=sex, y= age)) + geom_boxplot()
pp
